author: YellowToad

text:
When running around below a city under siege by an Arch Angel of Death it fits surprisingly well.
I'd almost go as far as to say that when I heard this song, it was the first time I actually thought to myself that "I really need to save this town, these people, the WORLD from the evil!"

I know I've already paid for the expansion, but Blizzard, take my money once again!
author: 六Michaloff

text:
That said though, nothing compares to the Tristram theme.
Nothing.

So it's unfair to compare anything to it.
That theme is pure perfection.
author: 六Michaloff

text: ? It's not meant to be like the Tristram Theme, this plays when a town is under siege and people are dying left, right and centre, not just while you're checking your stash ;)

author: nighthawk82

text: +doumekikun the music is generic, keep repeating the same loop with occasional variations.  Boring. Can not even be compared with Tristram soundtrack. Diablo 3 may have better graphics, but the music is much better in Diablo II  and it gives the game specific atmosphere that Diablo 3 has not.

author: earthwolf82

text:
crescendo, climax, descrescendo, tensions, epicness, sadness etc...
 yes nothing like tristram theme. :-)

This music fits better than tristram theme,  in the opening cinematic of Reaper of Souls, at the more intensive moment, when malthael blow the poors horadric guys whith his mortal fog.
author: jean-louis pech

text:
jean-louis pech imo, Tristram music is masterpiece. 
This music is just loop with variations on the main theme.
author: Ivan Antonijevic

text:
the loop is only for the strings, the basic layer of the music .
This is something like the bolero de ravel , it begins low with one layer , the staccato strings (  the first loop  ) , and loop after loop there are layers of additional instruments, and rise toward the climax.
The evolution is slow by purpose, this is a slow building.

This is a different composition, not the same  than tristan theme.
author: jean-louis pech

text: Quite. The D2 Tristram music is great, but it's a very different style to this, which is about depth rather than melody. If all you're hearing is repeated strings then you're not listening at all.
author: tagq2

text: Diablo III was such a good time until I hit level 60 and was spending more time on the Auction House than ingame. I haven't played since the end of 2012 and since I'm weak when it comes to the Diablo series, I bought this expansion and I'll start playing in a couple minutes (continuing my Witch Doctor). No more Auction House, smarter loot drops and new gameplay elements are very welcome and it makes me excited for it. We'll see how it goes!
author: SupraDarky

text: imo, they fixed everything that was wrong with the original end game. i dont think you'll be disappointed!

text:

text: @Hallow Knight Don't make me laugh. I thought Act V's storyline was amazing compared to Act I-IV. The audio and soundtracks were very well done, and the visuals and enviorments I got to see were breathtaking compared to the other acts, my favorite being the Pandemonium Fortress. I really loved Reaper of Souls.
author: Arynn Saevherne
Random Garreh

text: I am enjoying the game again now a lot too, I know this comment was posted a long time ago now but its fun to play now. They learned a lot I think from the mistake that was Diablo AH.
author: Raegal Dorn

text: I still play the game fairly regularly too since I started around the release date in May of 2012, grinding on my Wizard and Crusader primarily, and occasionally on my other characters. Loot 2.0 and Reaper of Souls were welcome changes to me since I hated the outrageously high prices people put up for items in the Auction House; The kind of money I could never get. Now, I can get Legendaries fairly easily, and thanks to my Boon of the Hoarder Legendary Gem, I now have enough gold to craft as many gems and items as I please while farming on Torment 1.
author: Arynn Saevherne

text: im in love with the game now. no auction house. you have to play to get a better gear. love it! im invincible with my wd!
